messageBody:
Problem is simple...
I use unit test to validate my environments dev / test / uat / ...
I created a DB validator that alllows me to quickly audit if a DB has
been correctly created & some generic informations are there, if the DB
is accessible, ....

Then for each DB I make custom tests :

* Are reference tables filled with +/- the right values ?
* Are all synonyms there ... ?


The DB validator contains thus among other methods :
<pre>
...
@Test public void accessDBSuccessfull ()
{ // SQLHelper is a little toolbox that allows to process query
// & simply connect to the DB
assertTrue(sqlHlpr.test()); // Just throws to the db a "select
1+1 from dual"
}
...
</pre>

My specific class relies on its parent to execute most of the hard work
:
<pre>
public class DB1Validation extends DBValidation {

public String ds = "jdbc/DB1";

public static final TestSuite suite()
{
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(DB1Validation.class);
String[] tables = new String[]
{"ERRORS", "ERROR_CODES", "EVENTS", "MASKS" };


suite.addTest(validateAllTables(tables));

return suite;
}
}
</pre>

If I don't create a suite-method, the code DB1Validation invokes the
parent test (accessDBSuccessfull) successfully. If I do create a suite
method as indicated, I get the following error :
